component_AccountSlideNew_import.message: Import an account from pre-existing phrase

component_Stats_account_one.message: You have $number$ account with a total

component_Stats_account_other.message: You have $number$ accounts with a total

view_Welcome_info.message: You currently don’t have any accounts.

view_Welcome_invitation.message: Create your first account to get started.

view_Welcome_import.message: Import an Account from pre-existing phrase

view_Warning_emphasis.message: The next Step is very important!

view_Warning_explanation.message: Please write down your wallet’s phrase and keep it in a safe place. We recommend you write down your backup phrase with a pencil and paper. The phrase must be used to restore your wallet.

view_Warning_emphasis_again.message:
Keep it carefully
to not lose your assets

view_Warning_CTA.message: I understand this - go to the Phrase

view_SaveBackupPhrase_explanation.message: You have to click or tap an empty field to see one word of the phrase. For the next step, you need your written words in the correct order.

view_VerifyBackupPhrase_explanation.message: To make sure that no mistake has crept into your phrase, sort your backup phrase into the correct order

view_VerifyBackupPhrase_error.message: Please put every word in the correct order

view_ImportBackupPhrase_explanation_impo.message: To import a Sporran account, you will need a pre-existing backup phrase consisting of 12-words

view_ImportBackupPhrase_explanation_rese.message: In order to set a new password you have to re-enter your backup phrase

view_ImportBackupPhrase_error_invalid_ba.message: The entered backup phrase doesn’t exist

view_ImportBackupPhrase_error_mismatched.message: This is not the backup phrase of this account

view_ImportBackupPhrase_error_backup_phr.message: Please insert all the words of the backup phrase

view_ImportBackupPhrase_error_typo.message: It looks like there’s a typo in this word

view_CreatePassword_explanation.message: You need a secure password for every account. A good one could look like this:

view_CreatePassword_error_cases.message: You need to use both uppercase and lowercase letters

view_CreatePassword_error_numbers.message: You need to use at least one number

view_CreatePassword_error_other.message: You need to use at least one special character

view_CreatePassword_error_length.message: You need to use at least $minimum$ characters

view_CreateAccountSuccess_message_create.message: You have successfully created a KILT Wallet

view_CreateAccountSuccess_message_import.message: You have successfully imported your KILT Wallet

view_CreateAccountSuccess_message_reset.message: You have successfully set a new password

view_ReceiveToken_explanation.message: Copy and send your wallet ID

view_RemoveAccount_subline.message: You’re about to remove your account

view_RemoveAccount_explanation.message: The next step will remove your account from the browser extension. This will not delete your account. You can add it again any time by importing your backup phrase.

view_SendToken_subline.message: Securely send some of your coins

view_SendToken_amount_invalid.message: The value entered is not a number

view_SendToken_amount_large.message: The amount entered exceeds your maximum sendable amount

view_SendToken_recipient_invalid.message: The recipient address is not properly formatted
